alert.note: Alert for Plumas (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 06 at 6:29PM PDT until June 06 at 9:00PM PDT by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM PDT THIS EVENING FOR PLUMAS COUNTY... At 629 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing the heavy rain has moved out of the area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding may be ongoing or expected to begin shortly. A rain gauge near Belden reported 1.02 inches of rain. More thunderstorms this evening may move over the same area to exasperate existing problems. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Belden and Tobin. CHP has reported lots of areas with rocks in the roadway of highway 70 in the warned area, mostly softball size. Follow CHP and CalTrans for updates on road conditions. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Move away from recently burned areas. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry areas is likely. The heavy rains will may trigger rockslides, mudslides and debris flows in steep terrain, especially in and around these areas.
